lexUnit.name: strait.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a narrow passage of water connecting two seas or other large areas of water

sentence.text: But this alliance was followed by others , with more accessible cities , Leontini on the east coast of Sicily , and Rhegion on the straits between Italy and Sicily , on the Italian side ( ML 63-4 ) , probably in about 443 .

It was unclear to them why St Petersburg should promise the Turks assistance in return for the closure of the Dardanelles , when closing the straits between the Aegean and the Black Sea was a longstanding Turkish principle .
Neither we nor the Western world as such would stand by and see the straits of the Persian Gulf closed to international traffic .
By mid-1991 Denmark was nearing agreement with Sweden on a long-standing plan to bridge the Ã–resund straits which divided the two countries [ see p. 38402 ] .
Their favourite sport entails swimming the straits in northern Scotland to better waylay and wreck passing freighters .
Cross the Strait by Menai Suspension Bridge .
Only four months previously the land had suddenly plummeted into the straits , taking with it a village of some eighty souls .
These tough little animals used to be swum across the narrow straits ( or Kyles , hence the alternative name ` Kyloe " for the breed ) between the islands and the mainland .
The Kyle road from Achmore curves round to renew acquaintance with Loch Carron as it passes through the narrow straits of Strome and widens into an estuary .
The Indonesian government has proposed the levying of a toll on ships passing through the Malacca strait to raise funds to combat pollution in the heavily used seaway .

And the Indonesian , Malaysian and Singapore governments took steps to implement the planned levy on ships passing through the Strait to help them meet the costs of accidents and pollution [ see ED 56 ] .
Currently an estimated 1,600 vessels carrying fuels and other hazardous materials pass through the strait annually .

Japan 's vital oil supplies from the Middle East are shipped through the strait .
